content.question: If \(f\) is continuous for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>a</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>b</mi> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGHbGaeyizImQaamiEaiabgsMiJkaadkgaaaa@3C4A@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and differentiable for a<x<b, which of the following could be false?

choices.label: <math aria-label="f prime of c equals open parentheses f of b minus f of a close parentheses divided by open parentheses b minus a close parentheses" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>c</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>b</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>b</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mi>a</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qaceWGMbGbauaacaGGOaGaam4yaiaacMcacqGH9aqpdaWcaaWdaeaa peGaamOzaiaacIcacaWGIbGaaiykaiabgkHiTiaadAgacaGGOaGaam yyaiaacMcaa8aabaWdbiaadkgacqGHsislcaWGHbaaaaaa@449E@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for some c such that a<c<b.
f'(c)=0 for some c such that a<c<b.

f has a minimum value on <math aria-label="a less than or equal to x less than or equal to b" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>a</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>b</mi> <mo>.</mo> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGHbGaeyizImQaamiEaiabgsMiJkaadkgacaGGUaaaaa@3CFC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

f has a maximum value on <math aria-label="a less than or equal to x less than or equal to b" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>a</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>b</mi> <mo>.</mo> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGHbGaeyizImQaamiEaiabgsMiJkaadkgacaGGUaaaaa@3CFC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

<math aria-label="the integral from a to b of f of x with respect to x" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <munderover> <mo>∫</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>b</mi> </munderover> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaWdXbWdaeaapeGaamOzaaWcpaqaa8qacaWGHbaapaqaa8qacaWG IbaaniabgUIiYdGccaGGOaGaamiEaiaacMcacaWGKbGaamiEaaaa@3FDA@</annotation> </semantics> </math> exists.

content.answer: f'(c)=0 for some c such that a<c<b.

topic.text: 5.2: Extreme Value Theorem, Global Versus Local Extrema, and Critical Points
